channel.title: Guides on Site Bay Guides & Tutorials
channel.description: Recent content in Guides on Site Bay Guides & Tutorials

item.title: Cancel Managed PostHog
item.description: If you no longer need Site Bay’s Managed PostHog offering, you can cancel it by contacting the Support team.

item.title: Configure Credentials for Managed PostHog
item.description: Many of the applications running on your servers can only be accessed with the appropriate username and password combination.

item.title: Configure Firewall Rules to Allow Access from Site Bay Infrastructure (for Managed PostHog Customers)
item.description: As a Managed PostHog customer, you may need to add or modify your firewall rules to allow access from our infrastructure.

item.title: Configure SSH Access for Managed PostHog
item.description: To troubleshoot an issue with a failed monitor check, the Support Team needs access to your system.

item.title: Manage Contacts for Managed PostHog
item.description: Service Monitors can be configured to email your team members in the event of an issue with your system.

item.title: Create and Edit Service Monitors for Managed PostHog
item.description: Managed PostHog monitors the posthog running on your WordPress Sites. Setting up posthog is an essential step in the configuration process.
